projectPurpose: To enhance the readability of log files in the terminal through automatic and customizable syntax/pattern highlighting.
mainFeatures: Log file highlighting (numbers, dates, IPs, UUIDs, URLs, etc.)
No setup or configuration required for basic use
Easy integration with other command-line tools (piping)
Uses 'less' as a pager for navigation and search

alternatives.name: ccze
mainFeatures: Supports various log formats (syslog, apache, etc.)

alternatives.name: lnav
mainFeatures: Merges logs from multiple files by time

alternatives.name: logalize
mainFeatures: Customizable formats, patterns, and words via YAML

marketPositioning: tailspin is positioned as a user-friendly, zero-configuration-by-default terminal log file highlighter. It offers immediate, intelligent highlighting of common log patterns, striking a balance between the basic functionality of core Unix tools like 'less' and 'grep' and the more advanced, often configuration-heavy features of dedicated log viewers like 'lnav' or 'ccze'. Its ease of use, integration with 'less', and focus on out-of-the-box highlighting make it accessible for users who need quick, enhanced log readability without deep customization initially, while still offering configuration options for advanced users.
